citation.article-title: Campylobacter pylori subsp. mustelae subsp. nov. isolated from the gastric mucosa of ferrets, Mustela putorius furo, and an emended description of Campylobacter pylori.

p.s: Description of Campylobucter pylori subsp. pylori subsp. nov.
Campylobucter pylori subsp. pylori (py. lor'i. L. gen. n. pylori, gatekeeper; of the pyloris)
Produces H2S in the lead acetate test.
Resistant to nalidixic acid and susceptible to cephalothin.
Exhibits leucine arylanidase activity in enzyme profiles (9).
Isolated from the gastric mucosa of humans.
The type strain is Royal Perth Hospital Isolate 13487 (= NCTC 11637 = ATCC 43504).
